intro: Haplocarpha lyrata, commonly known as the lyreleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. It is often found in moist meadows and along streambanks. Haplocarpha lyrata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
